text: Map showing ancient Thessaly. Elateia is shown to the upper centre. Elateia or Elatia () was a town in Pelasgiotis in ancient Thessaly, described by Livy, along with Gonnus, as situated in the pass leading to the Vale of Tempe."Utraque oppida in faucibus sunt, quae Tempe adeunt: magis Gonnus," Elateia is called Iletia by Pliny the Elder, and Iletium or Iletion (Ἰλέτιον) by Ptolemy. It is mentioned by Stephanus of Byzantium under its right name. Its site in unlocated. ==References== Category:Populated places in ancient Thessaly Category:Former populated places in Greece Category:Lost ancient cities and towns Category:Pelasgiotis
title: Elateia (Thessaly)
